alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Campbell; Grant; Kenton; Mason; Owen; Pendleton; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN MASON, ROBERTSON, SOUTHERN KENTON, BRACKEN, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, GRANT, OWEN, PENDLETON, SOUTHERN CLERMONT, SOUTHERN BROWN AND WEST CENTRAL ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Amelia to 9 miles northeast of New Castle, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Alexandria, Georgetown, Williamstown, Falmouth, Claryville, Crittenden, Bethel, New Richmond, Dry Ridge, Ripley, Aberdeen, Owenton, Augusta, Felicity, Brooksville, Butler, Morgan, Decatur and Russellville. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 144 and 168. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
